question:
District category contains Historic Neighborhood, and Heritage District.
Supermarkets category contains Lidl, and 99 Cents Only Stores.
Product category contains Beer, and Canned Coconut Milk.
Ingredient category contains Ghee, and Coconut Oil.
The number of each 99 Cents Only Stores 's Beer equals 7 more than the sum of each Lidl 's Beer and each 99 Cents Only Stores 's Canned Coconut Milk.
The number of each Lidl 's Beer equals 2.
The number of each Historic Neighborhood 's 99 Cents Only Stores equals each Beer 's Coconut Oil.
The number of each Canned Coconut Milk 's Ghee equals each Heritage District 's 99 Cents Only Stores.
The number of each Historic Neighborhood 's Lidl equals 12 more than each Heritage District 's Supermarkets.
The number of each Beer 's Coconut Oil equals 10 times each Lidl 's Canned Coconut Milk.
The number of each Heritage District 's Lidl equals 18.
The number of each Beer 's Ghee equals the difference of each Beer 's Coconut Oil and each Lidl 's Canned Coconut Milk.
The number of each 99 Cents Only Stores 's Canned Coconut Milk equals the sum of each Heritage District 's Lidl, each Heritage District 's Supermarkets, and each Historic Neighborhood 's Lidl.
The number of each Canned Coconut Milk 's Coconut Oil equals 20.
The number of each Heritage District 's 99 Cents Only Stores equals 18.
The number of each Lidl 's Canned Coconut Milk equals 14.
How many Lidl does Historic Neighborhood have?
solution:
Define each Heritage District 's Lidl as T; So T = 18.
Define each Heritage District 's 99 Cents Only Stores as G; So G = 18.
Define each Heritage District 's Supermarkets as w; So w = T + G = 18 + 18 = 13.
Define each Historic Neighborhood 's Lidl as l; So l = 12 + w = 12 + 13 = 2.
